author: jorgejaqa
title: Clean water, raise awareness.
description: 清洁的水是用20升的瓶子装的，不是来自 "可饮用 "的水，因为硬度大，而加密货币被看成是庞氏骗局。

f6_assessments.q0: I would like to start by congratulating the team for their remarkable social commitment. We need more individuals like you in the Cardano community. The purpose of this proposal is to address the issue of accessibility to clean water in remote communities with high poverty rates. The author of the proposal, an SPO, seeks funding for the installation of water purification systems in communities that lack access to basic services. Several communities in the region face this challenge, which is entirely in line with the mission of Cardano from a social perspective. I must admit that I find it very difficult to evaluate this proposal, since I believe it is an excellent proposal. However, in the way the proposal is described, and considering not only the social aspect, it is difficult to find a direct alignment with what is asked for in this challenge. Although it is mentioned that as part of the installation of these systems, knowledge characteristics of the Cardano ecosystem is imparted to these communities, no impact metrics are presented to assess it from that point of view.
f6_assessments.q1: I don't have many comments concerning the feasibility of the project. Given that the team already has a part of project underway, and from what they mention, they need funding to reach out to other communities, I believe they have the necessary skills and experience to pursue the project. Regarding the budget, there are also opportunities for improvement. Team members present a final value that is representative of the cost of installing a system in a community. In order to make an accurate assessment of the costs, a breakdown of the installation is necessary. How much will it cost to install the system, purchase the system, transportation, manage the project, and set up the installation room, for example?
f6_assessments.q2: Auditability is not a problem here. Within four months of receiving the funding, the team plans to install the five water purification systems. All of the installations will be open source, describing the drafts, locations, equipment, and details for replication all over the world, which is very positive. Nevertheless, it is necessary to make much greater efforts to ensure that operations are transparent for the community. The project mentions, for example, that initial installations have already taken place. Thus, it would be useful for all information to be provided on the website. Perhaps installation photos and cost reports verified by professionals?

f6_assessments.q0: Clean water for everybody is a good and noble idea. The problem statement and solution disconnected for me, I fail to understand how the water integrates with the blockchain and how it increases the utility of the chain. I would like the team to rework the problem statement and solution to be aligned.
f6_assessments.q1: From the described experience it seems the implementation of the water systems will be successfull. I fail to understand how the purification systems ties in with the blockchain backend, I would love the team to expand.
f6_assessments.q2: I would like the team develop a detailed roadmap with milestones. I would like the team to breakdown the expenditure further per site - is all the funding going to water purification hardware. I would like the team to think about the funds to maintain the purification systems. As the proposal stands at the moment I believe the project will be challenging to audit.

f6_assessments.q1: The experience of the proposer is seen here: https://github.com/jorgejaqa and his passion towards supporting communities with water , But I would suggest the proposer should set up a Team with required Skill to handle the SPO and the Project as well. f6_assessments.reply: Also budget breakdown and reasonability is a concept for the Feasibility Score and not the Auditability one, where we have provided 9 SMART KPIs and a Gitbook where we will be reporting all of our activities, so the proposal is Totally transparent and auditable by the community!

f6_assessments.q0:
I really love the meaning this project will bring to people there, and it will absolutely solve the problem that is met. 
The team has detailed info that shows that they're well aware of the problem and context surrounding the place that they want to solve the problem, and their solution can make an impact on the Cardano community. 
But lacking key metrics is hard to assess whether the project aligns with the challenge or not. Even reading the proposal we will know what the provided numbers say, but my advice is that the team should set some specific key metrics to show what they're really considering to.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is no roadmap and budget breakdown to clarify how the team implements the project and uses the budget. Therefore, it's hard to measure the feasibility of this project. 
In addition, lacking solution detail also can't help us understand how the team can solve the problem, there is an attached video but It cannot help that much. 
So, my advice is that the team should provide some detailed steps and plan that they will go for it. And have some risk-relevant with the implementation will help the proposal get a high rate for voting.
f6_assessments.q2:

I love to see their team can show how they can organize to reach and help these communities, that need some community development skills. And there are, maybe, some risks with the government that the team will meet and have to solve when on.
